article.headline: Western Michigan 69, Detroit 67
article.story: KALAMAZOO, Mich. (AP) -- Joe Reitz scored 19 points to lead Western Michigan to a 69-67 win over Detroit on Monday night. Detroit's Brandon Cotton scored 21 points and Ryvon Covile added 19 points and a career-high 14 rebounds and as the Titans rallied from a 13-point deficit and almost knocked off the Broncos (1-2) in the final seconds. Cotton, who scored 15 in the second half, made a running shot at the buzzer that caromed off the backboard and hit the rim. Nine of Covile's rebounds came in the second half, when the Titans (1-3) outrebounded Western Michigan 20-13. After cruising ahead by 13 points on a 3-pointer by Jon Workman with 7:41 left, the Broncos scored just two baskets the remainder of the game and missed five of seven free throws in the final minute. Covile helped Detroit's comeback by hitting six of eight free throws in the final five minutes. Brandon Bell came off the bench for Detroit to score 14 points. Workman, a freshman starting his first game, and Andrew Hershberger each scored 11 for Western Michigan, which avoided its first 0-3 start since 2000.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
